intro: Cinchona calisaya var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the Calisaya cinchona, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and elliptic to oblong leaves that are often dark green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries containing seeds. It is closely related to other cinchona species, some of which are sources of quinine. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
